line.commentary: This opening line introduces a fascinating concept about movement/change (動) in relation to the Dao. Notice how 者 marks the topic!
Similar grammatical structure to the first line. The character 用 has a basic meaning of 'use/function' but carries deeper implications about utility and purpose.
Here we see 萬物 (ten-thousand things) - a classical way to refer to 'everything in existence'. The structure 生於 (born-from) is key to understanding this cosmological statement.
A profound philosophical statement about origins. Consider: what does it mean for 'existence' itself to be born from 'non-existence'? Notice how the same characters 生於 are used again.
